page.title: 03LANDSCAPE CLAPHAM CONTINUED
page.content: On the edge of the village there are 4 farms.Behind the car park is a tennis court and beyond that are the grounds of Ingleborough Hall.This was once the home of the Lord of the Manor of Clapham,but is now a residential centre for field studies and outdoor activities.It is used mainly by children from the cities. The village hall has a central position,but the school stands at the south end of the village. To the north there are woods which have a nature trail running through the middle.There are 5 new houses in the nether regions of the village.They were built by the Joseph Rowntree Trust in 1984,and there are more to be built nearby.These homes are for first time buyers.
